title: Boeing Starliner test flight next on ULA’s launch schedule
summary: The U.S. Space Force has postponed a multi-spacecraft mission that was booked to fly on a United Launch Alliance Atlas 5 rocket in April, moving a redo of a test flight for Boeing’s Starliner crew capsule to the front of the line on ULA’s launch schedule.

title: No, Russia has not threatened to leave an American astronaut behind in space
summary: The status of the ISS partnership is subject to change, of course.

title: SpaceX to launch AST SpaceMobile’s first space-based cell towers
summary: AST Space Mobile says it has chosen SpaceX to launch its first operational BlueBird satellite after contracting the company to launch BlueWalker...

title: China to open space station to commercial activity
summary: China is planning to open its space station to commercial missions and activities, according to a senior human spaceflight program official.

title: Rocket Report: Ariane 6 workers are “hyperstressed,” SpaceX retort to Rogozin
summary: "The project adds another dimension to the representation of humanity in space."

title: Astrolab unveils Artemis lunar rover design
summary: A California startup has developed and tested a prototype of a lunar rover that it plans to offer to NASA for use on future Artemis missions.

title: SpaceX’s first 33-engine Super Heavy booster reaches full height
summary: Approximately 11 weeks after the process began, SpaceX has finished stacking its newest Super Heavy booster prototype – the first of its...

title: Soyuz embargo strands satellites with limited launch options
summary: More than a dozen former Soyuz satellite missions need new rides after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, raising questions over how the launch market can absorb the loss of the workhorse rocket.

title: Coverage, Activities Set for First Rollout of NASA’s Mega Moon Rocket
summary: NASA will hold a media teleconference on Monday, March 14 to discuss the upcoming debut of the agency’s Mega Moon rocket and integrated spacecraft for the uncrewed Artemis I lunar mission.

title: NASA to Air Briefing, Spacewalks to Upgrade Space Station
summary: Crew members from International Space Station Expedition 66 will conduct two spacewalks Tuesday, March 15, and Wednesday, March 23, to continue upgrades to the orbiting laboratory.
